module.name: DbCtrls
module.short: Data-Aware controls commonly used for viewing and operating on information held in databases

element.name: TFieldDataLink
element.short: TFieldDataLink - forms a link between a database field and an action

element.name: TFieldDataLink.ActiveChanged
element.short: ActiveChanged - method to process changes in the Active property

descr.p: ActiveChanged - method to process changes in the Active property
Any change to the Active property triggers the ActiveChanged method.
If the method is triggered by a transition into an Active state, then ActiveChanged ensures that this TFieldDataLink's Field is still valid before calling the event handler.
ActiveChanged calls an OnActiveChange event handler if one has been assigned.

element.name: TFieldDataLink.DataSetChanged
element.short: DataSetChanged - method to process a change in the DataSet

element.name: TFieldDataLink.EditingChanged
element.short: EditingChanged - method for processing changes in the Editing property

element.name: TFieldDataLink.LayoutChanged
element.short: LayoutChanged- called if layout is changed: tests validity of field then calls OnLayoutChange event handler

element.name: TFieldDataLink.RecordChanged
element.short: RecordChanged - triggered if the contents of the current record change; calls Reset

element.name: TFieldDataLink.UpdateData
element.short: UpdateData - if there are any pending changes, calls OnUpdateData event handler

element.name: TFieldDataLink.FocusControl
element.short: FocusControl - gives this control the input focus; calls the OnFocusRequest event handler

element.name: TFieldDataLink.Create
element.short: Create - calls inherited Create then initialises field information

element.name: TFieldDataLink.Edit
element.short: Edit - if the field can be modified, performs inherited Edit and shows editing status

element.name: TFieldDataLink.Modified
element.short: Modified sets the IsModified local variable to True

element.name: TFieldDataLink.Reset
element.short: Reset - checks that link is active, calls the OnDataChange event handler then sets IsModified to False

element.name: TFieldDataLink.Control
element.short: The Control to which this datalink is attached

element.name: TFieldDataLink.Field
element.short: The Field to which the datalink is attached

element.name: TFieldDataLink.FieldName
element.short: FieldName - the name of the attached field, stored as a string

element.name: TFieldDataLink.CanModify
element.short: CanModify - True if the linked field is capable of being modified

element.name: TFieldDataLink.Editing
element.short: Editing - True if the linked field is being edited

element.name: TFieldDataLink.OnDataChange
element.short: OnDataChange - event handler for a change in the data

element.name: TFieldDataLink.OnEditingChange
element.short: OnEditingChange - event handler for a changed in the Editing property

element.name: TFieldDataLink.OnUpdateData
element.short: OnUpdateData - event handler for updating any pending changes in the data

element.name: TFieldDataLink.OnActiveChange
element.short: OnActiveChange - event handler for a change in the Active property

element.name: TFieldDataLink.OnFocusRequest
element.short: OnFocusRequest - event handler for a request to give focus

element.name: TDBEdit
element.short: TDBEdit - a data-aware edit box for processing a single text-string from a dataset

element.name: TDBEdit.Create
element.short: Create - Constructor for TDBEdit: calls inherited Create then sets up data links and actions

element.name: TDBEdit.Destroy
element.short: Destroy - destructor for TDBEdit: frees data links then calls inherited Destroy

element.name: TDBEdit.Field
element.short: The field in the DataSet from which data are to be displayed in the Edit
element.descr: Refers to the complete Field entity, not just its name

element.name: TDBEdit.DataField
element.short: The name (as a string) of the field whose data are to be displayed

element.name: TDBEdit.DataSource
element.short: The DataSource to be used for supplying the data in the required Field. Ususally the result of a data query

descr.p: // standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants
Determines how the control is to be anchored to its client or parent control
Either reads a flag containing the set of anchors to be used, or writes a set of anchors. If they have been written, this is indicated in IsAnchorsStored
// standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants
AutoSize permits the size of a control to be adjusted automatically, for example a button can become bigger or smaller to accommodate a longer or shorter caption.
Reads logical (boolean) flag to see whether auto-sizing is to be operated, or writes the flag to say it should be done. Default is false, ie no auto-sizing
Indicates how text is displayed in a text editing control in the following ways:
The rules can, of course, be overridden by use of the shift key.
// standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants
Reads the value for colour, or stores the value, and sets a flag if the colour is stored.
The default colour is the same as the window in which the control is located.
// standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants
Determine Constraints (max and min height and width) for this control; reads the size constraints or stores new ones.
// standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants
Whether the control is Enabled. If not, it usually appears 'greyed-out'
Reads a flag to see whether the control is enabled, or stores a new value. If stored, sets a flag to say so.
// standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants
Reads a flag to see what font should be used, or sets a flag to store it. If stored, sets a flag to say so
The properties of Font are defined in the parent class TFont

PasswordChar
: the character which appears in the Edit box replacing and masking the actual character typed.
Typically used in password input, to prevent the typed characters from being seen by passers-by or casual observers (or even malicious observers!)

element.name: TDBEdit.PopupMenu
TDBEdit.ShowHint
element.descr:
// standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants
Reads flag or writes one to determine if a hint is to be shown when mouse hovers over this control. If value is stored, a storage flag is set. Display of the actual hint is controlled by OnShowHint

element.name: TDBEdit.TabOrder
element.descr: Reads or writes information in flag; default is -1

descr.p: Reads or writes boolean flag; default is False
Use the TabStop to allow or disallow access to the control using the Tab key.
If TabStop is True, the control is in the tab order. If TabStop is False, the control is not in the tab order and the user can't use the Tab key to move to the control.

descr.pre: The Visible property represents the ability to see a visual control. If Visible is True the control is shown, otherwise it is hidden. Calling Show sets, among others, Visible to True. Setting Visible to False is equivalent to calling Hide method.
descr.remark: The Visible property does not depend on control's parent visibility. Use IsVisible method to consider this and get real visibility.

descr.p: // standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants

This is often the default action for many controls, and is often the ONLY action specified by the programmer. The action can be spcified by the user, either by typing explicit code into the implementation section for this control, or by selecting an action from a pre-supplied ActionList
Reads or writes a flag if a mouse click is detected, and sets a flag if a value is stored.

Double-clicking is much more common in a Windows environment than in Unix or Linux, where single-clicking is the default method for selecting an object. However, in all environments there could be valid use for a double-click, and a method should be supplied if appropriate.
OnKeyDown - event handler for instance when key is down while control has focus
Differs from OnKeyPress in that the key may have already been down when the control received focus; with OnKeyPress the key needs to become pressed while the control has focus.
OnKeyPress - event controller for a key being pressed while the control has focus
Differs from OnKeyDown in that the key needs to become pressed while the control has focus; with OnKeyDown the key may have already been down when the control received focus.
OnKeyUp - event handler for instance when a key is up (not pressed) while the control has focus
The key may already have been up when the control received focus, or a pressed key may become released during the time the control has focus.

element.name: TDBText
element.short: TDBText - a data-aware text component to display a single text-string from a dataset

descr.p: Loaded is called by the streaming system when a root component was completely read from a stream and all properties and references to other objects have been resolved by the streaming system. Descendents of TComponent should override this method to do some additional processing of properties after all published properties have been set from values obtained from the stream.
Application programmers should never call Loaded directly, this is done automatically by the streaming system.

Notification is called whenever a child component is destroyed, inserted or removed from the list of owned component. Components that were requested to send a notification when they are freed ((with FreeNotification) will also call Notification when they are freed.

The AComponent parameter specifies which component sends the notification, and Operation specifies whether the component is being inserted into or removed from the child component list, or whether it is being destroyed.

Descendents of TComponent can use FreeNotification to request notification of the destruction of another object. By overriding the Notification method, they can do special processing (typically, set a reference to this component to Nil) when this component is destroyed. The Notification method is called quite often in the streaming process, so speed should be a consideration when overriding this method.

element.name: TDBText.Create
element.short: Create - constructor for TDBText: calls inherited Create then forms data links and actions

element.name: TDBText.Destroy
element.short: Destroy - destructor for TDBText: frees data links then calls inherited Destroy

element.name: TDBText.Field
element.short: The field in the DataSet to which this control is to be linked. Can be referred to by name, or as an index

descr.p: // standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants
Either reads a flag containing alignment instructions (FAlign) or writes alignment instructions (SetAlign)
May have no alignment, may have custom or client alignment, or can be aligned to top, bottom, left or right
// standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants
Determines how the control is to be anchored to its client or parent conrol
Either reads a flag containing the set of anchors to be used, or writes a set of anchors. If they have been written, this is indicated in IsAnchorsStored
// standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants
AutoSize permits the size of a control to be adjusted automatically, for example a button can become bigger or smaller to accommodate a longer or shorter caption.
Reads logical (boolean) flag to see whether auto-sizing is to be operated, or writes the flag to say it should be done. Default is false, ie no auto-sizing
Gets caption as a text-string (GetText), or stores the new caption (SetText). Shows flag if caption is stored (IsCaptionStored).
By default, the Caption appears the same as the control Name in the Object Inspector, and the developer needs to set it explicitly to some new text.
The VCL implementation relies on the virtual Get/SetTextBuf to exchange text between widgets and VCL. This means a lot of (unnecesary) text copies.
The LCL uses strings for exchanging text (more efficient). To maintain VCL compatibility, the virtual RealGet/SetText is introduced. These functions interface with the LCLInterface.
The default Get/SetTextBuf implementation calls the RealGet/SetText. As long as the Get/SetTextBuf isn't overridden Get/SetText calls RealGet/SetText to avoid PChar copying.
To keep things optimal, LCL implementations should always override RealGet/SetText. Get/SetTextBuf is only kept for compatibility.
// standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants
Reads the value for colour, or stores the value, and sets a flag if the colour is stored.
The default colour is the same as the window in which the control is located.

element.name: TDBText.DataField
element.short: The name of the field, as a string (ie cannot be referred to as an Index)

element.name: TDBText.DataSource
element.short: The DataSource from which information is obtained to display in this control. Usually the result of a SQLQuery

descr.p: // standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants
Reads a flag to see what font should be used, or sets a flag to store it. If stored, sets a flag to say so
The properties of Font are defined in the parent class TFont

ShowAccelChar
- underline the character in the label that acts as an accelerator with a shortcut key
Boolean property - default True

descr.pre: The Visible property represents the ability to see a visual control. If Visible is True the control is shown, otherwise it is hidden. Calling Show sets, among others, Visible to True. Setting Visible to False is equivalent to calling Hide method.
descr.remark: The Visible property does not depend on control's parent visibility. Use IsVisible method to consider this and get real visibility.

descr.p:
WordWrap
- whether a word is to be wrapped to the next line if the text is about to become too long for the width available
Boolean property, default False

element.name: TDBListBox
element.short: TDBListBox - a data-aware version of TListBox, for displaying lists of entries from a field in a database

descr.p: Loaded is called by the streaming system when a root component was completely read from a stream and all properties and references to other objects have been resolved by the streaming system. Descendents of TComponent should override this method to do some additional processing of properties after all published properties have been set from values obtained from the stream.
Application programmers should never call Loaded directly, this is done automatically by the streaming system.

Notification is called whenever a child component is destroyed, inserted or removed from the list of owned component. Components that were requested to send a notification when they are freed ((with FreeNotification) will also call Notification when they are freed.

The AComponent parameter specifies which component sends the notification, and Operation specifies whether the component is being inserted into or removed from the child component list, or whether it is being destroyed.

Descendents of TComponent can use FreeNotification to request notification of the destruction of another object. By overriding the Notification method, they can do special processing (typically, set a reference to this component to Nil) when this component is destroyed. The Notification method is called quite often in the streaming process, so speed should be a consideration when overriding this method.

element.name: TDBListBox.Click
element.short: Click - a procedure that allows the programmer to simulate a mouse click over the control, and initiates the same Action as that associated with the OnClick event

element.name: TDBListBox.EditingDone
element.short: EditingDone - what to do when you have finished editing

descr.p: Called when user has finished editing. This procedure can be used by data links to commit the changes.
For example:

ul.li: When focus switches to another control (default)

descr.p: It's totally up to the control, what events will commit.

element.name: TDBListBox.Create
element.short: Create - constructor for TDBListBox: calls inherited Create then forms data links and actions

element.name: TDBListBox.Destroy
element.short: Destroy - destructor for TDBListBox: frees data link then calls inherited Destroy

element.name: TDBListBox.Field
element.short: The Field of the DataSet for which data are to be displayed
element.descr: Regers to the whole Field entity, not just its name

descr.p: // standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants
Either reads a flag containing alignment instructions (FAlign) or writes alignment instructions (SetAlign)
May have no alignment, may have custom or client alignment, or can be aligned to top, bottom, left or right
// standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants
Determines how the control is to be anchored to its client or parent conrol
Either reads a flag containing the set of anchors to be used, or writes a set of anchors. If they have been written, this is indicated in IsAnchorsStored
// standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants

This is often the default action for many controls, and is often the ONLY action specified by the programmer. The action can be spcified by the user, either by typing explicit code into the implementation section for this control, or by selecting an action from a pre-supplied ActionList
Reads or writes a flag if a mouse click is detected, and sets a flag if a value is stored.

Double-clicking is much more common in a Windows environment than in Unix or Linux, where single-clicking is the default method for selecting an object. However, in all environments there could be valid use for a double-click, and a method should be supplied if appropriate.

OnDrawItem
- event handler for drawing an Item
For example, selecting an item may require it to be highlighted or have its font or background changed
OnKeyPress - event controller for a key being pressed while the control has focus
Differs from OnKeyDown in that the key needs to become pressed while the control has focus; with OnKeyDown the key may have already been down when the control received focus.
OnKeyDown - event handler for instance when key is down while control has focus
Differs from OnKeyPress in that the key may have already been down when the control received focus; with OnKeyPress the key needs to become pressed while the control has focus.
OnKeyUp - event handler for instance when a key is up (not pressed) while the control has focus
The key may already have been up when the control received focus, or a pressed key may become released during the time the control has focus.

element.name: TDBListBox.OnResize
element.descr:
// standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants
Reads or Writes flag if control is re-sized.

element.name: TDBListBox.ShowHint
element.descr:
// standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants
Reads flag or writes one to determine if a hint is to be shown when mouse hovers over this control. If value is stored, a storage flag is set. Display of the actual hint is controlled by OnShowHint

element.name: TDBListBox.TabOrder
element.descr: Reads or writes information in flag; default is -1

descr.p: Reads or writes boolean flag; default is False
Use the TabStop to allow or disallow access to the control using the Tab key.
If TabStop is True, the control is in the tab order. If TabStop is False, the control is not in the tab order and the user can't use the Tab key to move to the control.

descr.pre: The Visible property represents the ability to see a visual control. If Visible is True the control is shown, otherwise it is hidden. Calling Show sets, among others, Visible to True. Setting Visible to False is equivalent to calling Hide method.
descr.remark: The Visible property does not depend on control's parent visibility. Use IsVisible method to consider this and get real visibility.

element.name: TDBRadioGroup
element.short: TDBRadioGroup - a data-aware version of TRadioGroup, providing a series of mutually exclusive buttons to select an entry to insert into a database field

descr.p: The properties of TDBRadioGroup are similar to those of TRadioGroup (and TCustomRadioGroup). Access is obtained to members of the group by selecting (in the Object Inspector) the ellipsis (...) next to the entry Items, and then editing the stringlist.

At runtime, selecting one of the radiobuttons makes the corresponding ItemIndex available to the programmer, and the corresponding string Item gets selected and appears as the string value for the record in that field.

element.name: TDBRadioGroup.Change
element.short: Change - calls the OnChange event handler if it is assigned

element.name: TDBRadioGroup.DataChange
element.short: DataChange - updates the current Value to reflect a change inthe data

element.name: TDBRadioGroup.UpdateData
element.short: UpdateData - places the current Value into the data

element.name: TDBRadioGroup.DataLink
element.short: DataLink - the field data link to be used for the data

element.name: TDBRadioGroup.GetButtonValue
element.short: GetButtonValue - returns the string value of the button associated with the specified index

element.name: TDBRadioGroup.UpdateRadioButtonStates
element.short: UpdateRadioButtonStates - performs the inheited method and ensures that any updates are also reflected via the data link, if it is active and in an Editing state

element.name: TDBRadioGroup.EditingDone
element.short: EditingDone - updates the record through the datalink, then calls inherited EditingDone

element.name: TDBRadioGroup.Create
element.short: Create - constructor for TDBRadioGroup: calls inherited Create then forms datalinks and actions

element.name: TDBRadioGroup.Destroy
element.short: Destroy - destructor for TDBRadioGroup: frees links and items, then calls inherited Destroy

element.name: TDBRadioGroup.Field
element.short: The DataSet Field relevant to the data being selected
element.descr: Refers to the complete Field entity, not just its name

element.name: TDBRadioGroup.Value
element.short: The selected value (as indicated by ItemIndex)

descr.p: // standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants
Either reads a flag containing alignment instructions (FAlign) or writes alignment instructions (SetAlign)
May have no alignment, may have custom or client alignment, or can be aligned to top, bottom, left or right
// standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants
Determines how the control is to be anchored to its client or parent conrol
Either reads a flag containing the set of anchors to be used, or writes a set of anchors. If they have been written, this is indicated in IsAnchorsStored
Gets caption as a text-string (GetText), or stores the new caption (SetText). Shows flag if caption is stored (IsCaptionStored).
By default, the Caption appears the same as the control Name in the Object Inspector, and the developer needs to set it explicitly to some new text.
The VCL implementation relies on the virtual Get/SetTextBuf to exchange text between widgets and VCL. This means a lot of (unnecesary) text copies.
The LCL uses strings for exchanging text (more efficient). To maintain VCL compatibility, the virtual RealGet/SetText is introduced. These functions interface with the LCLInterface.
The default Get/SetTextBuf implementation calls the RealGet/SetText. As long as the Get/SetTextBuf isn't overridden Get/SetText calls RealGet/SetText to avoid PChar copying.
To keep things optimal, LCL implementations should always override RealGet/SetText. Get/SetTextBuf is only kept for compatibility.
Don't confuse this with the Columns entity in a DBGrid, nor with the COLUMNS entity in a SQL database - it simply refers to the number of columns of radiobuttons to be displayed

element.name: TDBRadioGroup.DataField
element.short: The name (as a string) of the Field whose data are linked to the control

element.name: TDBRadioGroup.DataSource
element.short: The DataSource from which relevant Field data are to be linked - usually the result of a database query

descr.p: // standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants
Whether the control is Enabled. If not, it usually appears 'greyed-out'
Reads a flag to see whether the control is enabled, or stores a new value. If stored, sets a flag to say so.

element.name: TDBRadioGroup.OnChange
element.short: Event Handler for any change in the radiogroup selection

descr.p: // standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants
Reads or Writes flag if bounds are changed
// standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants

This is often the default action for many controls, and is often the ONLY action specified by the programmer. The action can be spcified by the user, either by typing explicit code into the implementation section for this control, or by selecting an action from a pre-supplied ActionList
Reads or writes a flag if a mouse click is detected, and sets a flag if a value is stored.

element.name: TDBRadioGroup.OnResize
element.descr:
// standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants
Reads or Writes flag if control is re-sized.

element.name: TDBRadioGroup.ReadOnly
element.short: ReadOnly - if True, data can only be read, not written or modified. (Doesn't really make sense for a RadioGroup!)

element.name: TDBRadioGroup.Values
element.short: The values of the strings in Items

descr.pre: The Visible property represents the ability to see a visual control. If Visible is True the control is shown, otherwise it is hidden. Calling Show sets, among others, Visible to True. Setting Visible to False is equivalent to calling Hide method.
descr.remark: The Visible property does not depend on control's parent visibility. Use IsVisible method to consider this and get real visibility.

element.name: TDBCheckBox
element.short: TDBCheckBox - a data-aware checkbox for use with logical fields in a database

element.name: TDBCheckBox.GetFieldCheckState
element.short: GetFieldCheckState - returns the checkbox state for the current field

element.name: TDBCheckBox.DataChange
element.short: DataChange - uses GetFieldCheckState to update the State

element.name: TDBCheckBox.UpdateData
element.short: UpdateData - examines the State to see whether it has changed

element.name: TDBCheckBox.FocusRequest
element.short: FocusRequest - a request has been received, so Sets Focus

element.name: TDBCheckBox.EditingDone
element.short: EditingDone - if the datalink is in an Editing state, updates the data through the link then calls inherited EditingDone

element.name: TDBCheckBox.Create
element.short: Create - constructor for TDBCheckBox: calls inherited Create, forms logical connections for checked and unchecked, sets initial style and state, forms datalinks and actions

element.name: TDBCheckBox.Destroy
element.short: Destroy - destructor for TDBCheckBox: frees links and calls inherited Destroy

element.name: TDBCheckBox.Field
element.short: The Field in the DataSet with which the box is to be associated

descr.p: Refers to the whole Field entity, not just its name
See TCheckBoxState for possible values of State.

If AllowGrayed is set to True, the check box has three possible states: checked, unchecked and grayed. If AllowGrayed is set to False, the check box has only two possible states: checked and unchecked.
// standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants
Determines how the control is to be anchored to its client or parent conrol
Either reads a flag containing the set of anchors to be used, or writes a set of anchors. If they have been written, this is indicated in IsAnchorsStored
// standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants
AutoSize permits the size of a control to be adjusted automatically, for example a button can become bigger or smaller to accommodate a longer or shorter caption.
Reads logical (boolean) flag to see whether auto-sizing is to be operated, or writes the flag to say it should be done. Default is false, ie no auto-sizing
Gets caption as a text-string (GetText), or stores the new caption (SetText). Shows flag if caption is stored (IsCaptionStored).
By default, the Caption appears the same as the control Name in the Object Inspector, and the developer needs to set it explicitly to some new text.
The VCL implementation relies on the virtual Get/SetTextBuf to exchange text between widgets and VCL. This means a lot of (unnecesary) text copies.
The LCL uses strings for exchanging text (more efficient). To maintain VCL compatibility, the virtual RealGet/SetText is introduced. These functions interface with the LCLInterface.
The default Get/SetTextBuf implementation calls the RealGet/SetText. As long as the Get/SetTextBuf isn't overridden Get/SetText calls RealGet/SetText to avoid PChar copying.
To keep things optimal, LCL implementations should always override RealGet/SetText. Get/SetTextBuf is only kept for compatibility.

element.name: TDBCheckBox.DataField
element.short: The name (as a string) of the field with which the checkbox is to be associated

element.name: TDBCheckBox.DataSource
element.short: The DataSource containing the Field that is to be associated with this checkbox

descr.p: // standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants
Whether the control is Enabled. If not, it usually appears 'greyed-out'
Reads a flag to see whether the control is enabled, or stores a new value. If stored, sets a flag to say so.
Hint - a small informative pop-up box that appears when the mouse 'hovers' over a control
Requires ShowHint to be True
// standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants

This is often the default action for many controls, and is often the ONLY action specified by the programmer. The action can be spcified by the user, either by typing explicit code into the implementation section for this control, or by selecting an action from a pre-supplied ActionList
Reads or writes a flag if a mouse click is detected, and sets a flag if a value is stored.

element.name: TDBCheckBox.PopupMenu
TDBCheckBox.ReadOnly
element.short: ReadOnly - if True, data may be read but not written or modified (doesn't make much sense for a check-box unless the box is NOT Enabled!)

element.name: TDBCheckBox.ShowHint
element.descr:
// standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants
Reads flag or writes one to determine if a hint is to be shown when mouse hovers over this control. If value is stored, a storage flag is set. Display of the actual hint is controlled by OnShowHint

element.name: TDBCheckBox.TabOrder
element.descr: Reads or writes information in flag; default is -1

element.name: TDBCheckBox.TabStop
element.descr:
Use the TabStop to allow or disallow access to the control using the Tab key.
If the TabStop is True, the control is in the tab order. If TabStop is False, the control is not in the tab order and the user can't press the Tab key to move to the control.

element.name: TDBCheckBox.ValueChecked
element.short: ValueChecked - the box for the value has been checked

element.name: TDBCheckBox.ValueUnchecked
element.short: ValueUnchecked -the box for the value is unchecked

descr.pre: The Visible property represents the ability to see a visual control. If Visible is True the control is shown, otherwise it is hidden. Calling Show sets, among others, Visible to True. Setting Visible to False is equivalent to calling Hide method.
descr.remark: The Visible property does not depend on control's parent visibility. Use IsVisible method to consider this and get real visibility.

element.name: TDBComboBox
element.short: TDBComboBox - a data-aware version of TComboBox to allow selection of a value from a list of entries into a database field

descr.p: TDBComboBox has properties similar to TComboBox and TCustomComboBox. It consists of an Edit Box which is th eData-aware part of the component, and a drop-down list box.
In a typical application a user would be presented with the drop-down list, would make a selection and then this would appear in the edit box and become the data value for that cell in the database.
So for example a list of countries might be presented, and the selected value from the list would be used to populate the appropriate field ('Country') in that record of the database.

element.name: TDBComboBox.DataChange
element.short: DataChange - updates the text if it has changed

element.name: TDBComboBox.EditingChange
element.short: EditingChange - (currently no action)

element.name: TDBComboBox.UpdateData
element.short: UpdateData - copies the new data via the datalink

element.name: TDBComboBox.FocusRequest
element.short: FocusRequest - a request has been received and Focus is set

element.name: TDBComboBox.Create
element.short: Create - constructor for TDBComboBox: calls inherited Create then sets default style and forms datalinks and actions

element.name: TDBComboBox.Destroy
element.short: Destroy - destructor for TDBComboBox: frees datalinks then calls inherited Destroy

element.name: TDBComboBox.Field
element.short: The field in the dataset to which this control is attached

element.name: TDBComboBox.Text
element.short: Text - the string appearing in the main box. If an item on the drop-down list is selected, it replaces the contents of Text

element.name: TDBComboBox.ItemIndex
element.short: Index - the number of the currently selected item (starting at zero)

descr.p:
Index
- the number of the currently selected item
The first item has number 0, the second has number 1, the third number 2, etc.
In case no item is selected, ItemIndex has value -1.
// standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants
Determines how the control is to be anchored to its client or parent conrol
Either reads a flag containing the set of anchors to be used, or writes a set of anchors. If they have been written, this is indicated in IsAnchorsStored

AutoDropDown
- if True, the drop-down list appears as soon as the cursor moves over the text box
If False, the drop-down box only appears when the downward triangular indicator at the end of the box is selected
// standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants
Whether the control is Enabled. If not, it usually appears 'greyed-out'
Reads a flag to see whether the control is enabled, or stores a new value. If stored, sets a flag to say so.

element.name: TDBComboBox.Font
element.short: The Font to be used for text in this control

descr.p: // standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants
Reads a flag to see what font should be used, or sets a flag to store it. If stored, sets a flag to say so
The properties of Font are defined in the parent class TFont
// standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants

This is often the default action for many controls, and is often the ONLY action specified by the programmer. The action can be spcified by the user, either by typing explicit code into the implementation section for this control, or by selecting an action from a pre-supplied ActionList
Reads or writes a flag if a mouse click is detected, and sets a flag if a value is stored.
OnKeyDown - event handler for instance when key is down while control has focus
Differs from OnKeyPress in that the key may have already been down when the control received focus; with OnKeyPress the key needs to become pressed while the control has focus.
OnKeyPress - event controller for a key being pressed while the control has focus
Differs from OnKeyDown in that the key needs to become pressed while the control has focus; with OnKeyDown the key may have already been down when the control received focus.
OnKeyUp - event handler for instance when a key is up (not pressed) while the control has focus
The key may already have been up when the control received focus, or a pressed key may become released during the time the control has focus.

element.name: TDBComboBox.ShowHint
element.descr:
// standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants
Reads flag or writes one to determine if a hint is to be shown when mouse hovers over this control. If value is stored, a storage flag is set. Display of the actual hint is controlled by OnShowHint

element.name: TDBComboBox.TabOrder
element.descr: Reads or writes information in flag; default is -1

descr.p: Reads or writes boolean flag; default is False
Use the TabStop to allow or disallow access to the control using the Tab key.
If TabStop is True, the control is in the tab order. If TabStop is False, the control is not in the tab order and the user can't use the Tab key to move to the control.

descr.pre: The Visible property represents the ability to see a visual control. If Visible is True the control is shown, otherwise it is hidden. Calling Show sets, among others, Visible to True. Setting Visible to False is equivalent to calling Hide method.
descr.remark: The Visible property does not depend on control's parent visibility. Use IsVisible method to consider this and get real visibility.

element.name: TDBMemo
element.short: TDBMemo - a data-aware Memo box to process the multi-line text of a single field in a dataset

element.name: TDBMemo.DataChange
element.short: DataChange - if Data changed, loads the new data into the appropriate part of the Field

element.name: TDBMemo.UpdateData
element.short: UpdateData - if data changed, copy new text via the datalink

element.name: TDBMemo.FocusRequest
element.short: FocusRequest - a request has been received, so focus is given

element.name: TDBMemo.EditingDone
element.short: EditingDone - if link allows modifications and is in an Editing state, updates data via the link then calls inherited EditingDone

element.name: TDBMemo.Create
element.short: Create - constructor for TDBMemo: calls inherited Create, then sets style and forms datalinks and actions

element.name: TDBMemo.Destroy
element.short: Destroy - destructor for TDBMemo: frees datalinks then calls inherited Destroy

element.name: TDBMemo.LoadMemo
element.short: LoadMemo - tries to load data from current field as a string if possible, otherwise returns an exception

element.name: TDBMemo.Field
element.short: The field in the DataSet to which this control is to be linked. Can be referred to by name, or as an index

element.name: TDBMemo.AutoDisplay
element.short: AutoDisplay - if True, automatically displays the data when loaded

element.name: TDBMemo.DataField
element.short: The name of the field, as a string (ie cannot be referred to as an Index)

element.name: TDBMemo.DataSource
element.short: The DataSource from which information is obtained to display in this control. Usually the result of a database query

element.name: TDBGroupBox
element.short: TDBGroupBox - a data-aware version of TGroupBox, allowing a number of data-aware objects to be grouped together on a form

element.name: TDBGroupBox.FDataLink
element.short: FDataLink - local variable storing the identity of the Field Data Link

element.name: TDBGroupBox.GetDataField
element.short: GetDataField - returns the name of the data field

element.name: TDBGroupBox.GetDataSource
element.short: GetDataSource - returns the identity of the data source

element.name: TDBGroupBox.GetField
element.short: GetField - returns the identity of the field to which the group box is atttached

element.name: TDBGroupBox.SetDataField
element.short: SetDataField - specifies the data field to which the group box is attached

element.name: TDBGroupBox.SetDataSource
element.short: SetDataSource - specifies the data source to be used by the group box

element.name: TDBGroupBox.DataChange
element.short: DataChange - if Data changed, loads the new data into the caption

descr.p: Loaded is called by the streaming system when a root component was completely read from a stream and all properties and references to other objects have been resolved by the streaming system. Descendents of TComponent should override this method to do some additional processing of properties after all published properties have been set from values obtained from the stream.
Application programmers should never call Loaded directly, this is done automatically by the streaming system.

Notification is called whenever a child component is destroyed, inserted or removed from the list of owned component. Components that were requested to send a notification when they are freed ((with FreeNotification) will also call Notification when they are freed.

The AComponent parameter specifies which component sends the notification, and Operation specifies whether the component is being inserted into or removed from the child component list, or whether it is being destroyed.

Descendents of TComponent can use FreeNotification to request notification of the destruction of another object. By overriding the Notification method, they can do special processing (typically, set a reference to this component to Nil) when this component is destroyed. The Notification method is called quite often in the streaming process, so speed should be a consideration when overriding this method.

element.name: TDBGroupBox.Create
element.short: Create - constructor for TDBGroupBox: calls inherited Create then sets up datalinks and actions

element.name: TDBGroupBox.Destroy
element.short: Destroy - destructor for TDBGroupBox: frees datalinks then calls inherited Destroy

element.name: TDBGroupBox.Field
element.short: The field in the DataSet to which this control is to be linked. Can be referred to by name, or as an index

descr.p: // standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants
Either reads a flag containing alignment instructions (FAlign) or writes alignment instructions (SetAlign)
May have no alignment, may have custom or client alignment, or can be aligned to top, bottom, left or right
// standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants
Determines how the control is to be anchored to its client or parent conrol
Either reads a flag containing the set of anchors to be used, or writes a set of anchors. If they have been written, this is indicated in IsAnchorsStored
Gets caption as a text-string (GetText), or stores the new caption (SetText). Shows flag if caption is stored (IsCaptionStored).
By default, the Caption appears the same as the control Name in the Object Inspector, and the developer needs to set it explicitly to some new text.
The VCL implementation relies on the virtual Get/SetTextBuf to exchange text between widgets and VCL. This means a lot of (unnecesary) text copies.
The LCL uses strings for exchanging text (more efficient). To maintain VCL compatibility, the virtual RealGet/SetText is introduced. These functions interface with the LCLInterface.
The default Get/SetTextBuf implementation calls the RealGet/SetText. As long as the Get/SetTextBuf isn't overridden Get/SetText calls RealGet/SetText to avoid PChar copying.
To keep things optimal, LCL implementations should always override RealGet/SetText. Get/SetTextBuf is only kept for compatibility.
// standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants
Finds or sets the client height, and sets a flag if it has been stored

element.name: TDBGroupBox.ClientWidth
element.short: ClientWidth - determines the width of the client within which the control exists

descr.p: // standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants
ClientWidth - determines the width of the client within which the control exists; reads the width of the client control or sets the value. Sets flag if value is stored
// standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants
Reads the value for colour, or stores the value, and sets a flag if the colour is stored.
The default colour is the same as the window in which the control is located.
// standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants
Determine Constraints (max and min height and width) for this control; reads the size constraints or stores new ones.

element.name: TDBGroupBox.DataField
element.short: The name of the field, as a string (ie cannot be referred to as an Index)

element.name: TDBGroupBox.DataSource
element.short: The DataSource from which information is obtained to display in this control. Usually the result of a SQLQuery

descr.p: // standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants
Whether the control is Enabled. If not, it usually appears 'greyed-out'
Reads a flag to see whether the control is enabled, or stores a new value. If stored, sets a flag to say so.
// standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants
Reads a flag to see what font should be used, or sets a flag to store it. If stored, sets a flag to say so
The properties of Font are defined in the parent class TFont
// standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants

This is often the default action for many controls, and is often the ONLY action specified by the programmer. The action can be spcified by the user, either by typing explicit code into the implementation section for this control, or by selecting an action from a pre-supplied ActionList
Reads or writes a flag if a mouse click is detected, and sets a flag if a value is stored.

Double-clicking is much more common in a Windows environment than in Unix or Linux, where single-clicking is the default method for selecting an object. However, in all environments there could be valid use for a double-click, and a method should be supplied if appropriate.
OnKeyDown - event handler for instance when key is down while control has focus
Differs from OnKeyPress in that the key may have already been down when the control received focus; with OnKeyPress the key needs to become pressed while the control has focus.
OnKeyPress - event controller for a key being pressed while the control has focus
Differs from OnKeyDown in that the key needs to become pressed while the control has focus; with OnKeyDown the key may have already been down when the control received focus.
OnKeyUp - event handler for instance when a key is up (not pressed) while the control has focus
The key may already have been up when the control received focus, or a pressed key may become released during the time the control has focus.

element.name: TDBGroupBox.OnResize
element.descr:
// standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants
Reads or Writes flag if control is re-sized.

element.name: TDBGroupBox.PopupMenu
TDBGroupBox.ShowHint
element.descr:
// standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants
Reads flag or writes one to determine if a hint is to be shown when mouse hovers over this control. If value is stored, a storage flag is set. Display of the actual hint is controlled by OnShowHint

element.name: TDBGroupBox.TabOrder
element.descr: Reads or writes information in flag; default is -1

descr.p: Reads or writes boolean flag; default is False
Use the TabStop to allow or disallow access to the control using the Tab key.
If TabStop is True, the control is in the tab order. If TabStop is False, the control is not in the tab order and the user can't use the Tab key to move to the control.

descr.pre: The Visible property represents the ability to see a visual control. If Visible is True the control is shown, otherwise it is hidden. Calling Show sets, among others, Visible to True. Setting Visible to False is equivalent to calling Hide method.
descr.remark: The Visible property does not depend on control's parent visibility. Use IsVisible method to consider this and get real visibility.

element.name: TDBImage
element.short: TDBImage - a data-aware Image box to display a single image from a dataset
element.descr: The Image is stored in the database as a Binary Large Object (BLOB)

element.name: TDBImage.DataChange
element.short: DataChange - if data changed, load new picture

element.name: TDBImage.UpdateData
element.short: UpdateData - if data changed, save new picture

element.name: TDBImage.LoadPicture
element.short: LoadPicture - loads picture into the appropriate field for the graphic class of the caller

element.name: TDBImage.Create
element.short: Create - constructor for TDBImage: cals inherited Create then sets style and display methods, forms datalinks and actions

element.name: TDBImage.Destroy
element.short: Destroy - destructor for TDBImage: frees datalinks and calls inherited Destroy

element.name: TDBImage.Field
element.short: The Field in which picture data are stored

element.name: TDBImage.AutoDisplay
element.short: AutoDisplay - if True, automatically displays when focus is given

element.name: TDBImage.DataField
element.short: The name of the DataField that holds the image

element.name: TDBImage.DataSource
element.short: The identity of the DataSource that holds the image

element.name: TDBImage.Picture
element.short: The picture that is to be stored or displayed

element.name: TDBImage.Proportional
element.short: True if image is proportional

element.name: TDBImage.QuickDraw
element.short: QuickDraw - if True, quick drawing is implemented

element.name: TDBImage.ReadOnly
element.short: ReadOnly if True, image can be inspected byt not modified or written

element.name: TDBCalendar
element.short: TDBCalendar - a data-aware version of TCalendar, for selecting a date to put in a database field
element.descr: A pop-up calendar appears, and the user can navigate through years, months and days to select the date that is required. When a date is selected, it is inserted into the Date field of the appropriate record in the database.

element.name: TDBCalendar.FDataLink
element.short: FDataLink - local variable to hold identity of the field data link

element.name: TDBCalendar.DataChange
element.short: DataChange - if the link is active, transmit the changed data

element.name: TDBCalendar.UpdateData
element.short: UpdateData copy changed data into the text fileld

element.name: TDBCalendar.FocusRequest
element.short: FocusRequest - a request has been received to give focus, so it is given

element.name: TDBCalendar.GetDataField
element.short: GetDataField - returns the name of the Data Field

element.name: TDBCalendar.GetDataSource
element.short: GetDataSource - returns the identity of the data source

element.name: TDBCalendar.GetField
element.short: GetField - returns the identity of the data field

element.name: TDBCalendar.GetReadOnly
element.short: GetReadOnly - returns the ReadOnly state

element.name: TDBCalendar.SetReadOnly
element.short: SetReadOnly - specifies the value for ReadOnly

element.name: TDBCalendar.SetDate
element.short: SetDate - specifies the date as a string

element.name: TDBCalendar.SetDataField
element.short: SetDataField - specifies the data field to use for the calendar

element.name: TDBCalendar.SetDataSource
element.short: SetDataSource - specifies the data source to which the calendar is linked

element.name: TDBCalendar.EditingDone
element.short: EditingDone - changes data over the link then calls inherited EditingDone

element.name: TDBCalendar.Create
element.short: Create - constructor for TDBCalendar: calls inherited Create and forms datalinks and actions

element.name: TDBCalendar.Destroy
element.short: Destroy - destructor for TDBCalendar: frees datalinks and calls inherited Destroy

element.name: TDBCalendar.Field
element.short: The Field to which the calendar is attached

element.name: TDBCalendar.DataField
element.short: The name of the DataField as a string

element.name: TDBCalendar.DataSource
element.short: The identity of the DataSource holding the date information

element.name: TDBCalendar.Date
element.short: The Date obtained from the Calendar

element.name: TDBNavButtonType
element.short: TDBNavButtonType

element.name: TDBCustomNavigator
element.short: TDBCustomNavigator - the base class for TDBNavigator, a tool for navigating through the records of a dataset

descr.p: TDBCustomNavigator is the parent class for TDBNavigator, an advanced tool for navigating through datasets held locally in response to a query sent to the database. Most of the important properties are defined here.

It consists of a series of toolbuttons to move to the First, Prior, Next or Last record; to Insert or Delete a record; to Edit a record (enter Edit mode), to Post the changes. to Cancel the changes, and to Refresh the display from the database. The set of buttons for display can be customised in VisibleButtons, which allows display of individual buttons to be suppressed

If used in conjunction with a DataAware control such as TDBGrid or TDBMemo it controls which records are displayed , the position of the record selection cursor, and the initiation of changes to the dataset and ultimately the database.

Most of the functionality of the toolbar is already built-in to the control, but if the programmer needs to specify actions to be associated with individual buttons, there is a procedure BtnClick to which an argument can be sent with the index value of the button clicked, and the procedure chooses which action to call dependent on the button index.
The DataSource property must be set to link to the appropriate set of data.

element.name: TDBCustomNavigator.Buttons
element.short: The list of Buttons included in the navigator tool

element.name: TDBCustomNavigator.DataChanged
element.short: DataChanged - update status of all the buttons to reflect new data

element.name: TDBCustomNavigator.EditingChanged
element.short: EditingChanged - the status of the buttons is set to CanModify

element.name: TDBCustomNavigator.ActiveChanged
element.short: ActiveChanged - if datalink is active, calls DataChanged and EditingChanged

element.name: TDBCustomNavigator.UpdateButtons
element.short: UpdateButtons - if the position of the buttons need to be changed, does this, then updates the status of the buttons (see ActiveChanged)

element.name: TDBCustomNavigator.UpdateHints
element.short: UpdateHints - reloads the default hints and modifies any that have been changed

element.name: TDBCustomNavigator.HintsChanged
element.short: HintsChanged - calls UpdateHints

element.name: TDBCustomNavigator.ButtonClickHandler
element.short: ButtonClickHandler - performs BtnClick for the appropriate button

element.name: TDBCustomNavigator.DoOnResize
element.short: DoOnResize - calls UpdateButtons

element.name: TDBCustomNavigator.BeginUpdateButtons
element.short: BeginUpdateButtons - locks the buttons before updating them

element.name: TDBCustomNavigator.EndUpdateButtons
element.short: EndUpdateButtons - unlocks each button in turn and updates it if needed

element.name: TDBCustomNavigator.Create
element.short: Create - constructor for TDBCustomNavigator: locks the buttons, calls inherited Create, sets default size, style, forms datalinks, initialises hints, updates the buttons

element.name: TDBCustomNavigator.Destroy
element.short: Destroy - destructor for TDBCustomNavigator: frees datalinks and hints, then calls inherited Destroy

element.name: TDBCustomNavigator.BtnClick
element.short: BtnClick - procedure to respond to button clicks, and select an action from a list according to the value of the Index of the clicked button

element.name: TDBCustomNavigator.VisibleButtonCount
element.short: Finds the number of visible buttons

element.name: TDBCustomNavigator.BeforeAction
element.short: BeforeAction - code to be executed before an action is performed

element.name: TDBCustomNavigator.ConfirmDelete
element.short: Should the user be asked for confirmation before a record is deleted? If True, a dialog appears asking for confirmation

element.name: TDBCustomNavigator.DataSource
element.short: The Data Source to which the control must be linked in order to function

element.name: TDBCustomNavigator.Direction
element.short: The direction in which the buttons appear: horizontal or vertical

element.name: TDBCustomNavigator.Flat
element.short: Flat - if True, buttons have no 3-D effect

element.name: TDBCustomNavigator.Hints
element.short: A list of hints to be shown if the mouse hovers over a button

element.name: TDBCustomNavigator.OnClick
element.short: The action to be taken when a navigator button is clicked

element.name: TDBCustomNavigator.VisibleButtons
element.short: The set of visible buttons (some of them can be suppressed if their function appears redundant)

descr.p: The VisibleButtons entry in the Object Inspector can be used to set whether or not a particular button is to be visible.

element.name: TDBCustomNavigator.ShowButtonHints
element.short: Determines whether button hints are to be shown

element.name: TDBNavButton
element.short: TDBNavButton - one of the SpeedButtons on a TDBNavigator tool

element.name: TDBNavButton.NavStyle
element.short: NavStyle - the style of Navigator Button

element.name: TDBNavButton.Index
element.short: Index - the value from the enumerated type that specifies which button is being selected

descr.p: Button may be
nbFirst, nbPrior, nbNext, nbLast, nbInsert, nbDelete, nbEdit, nbPost, nbCancel, nbRefresh

element.name: TDBNavDataLink
element.short: TDBNavDataLink - provides a link between a Database Navigator and a DataSet

element.name: TDBNavDataLink.EditingChanged
element.short: EditingChanged - method to process a change in the Editing property of the navigator

element.name: TDBNavDataLink.DataSetChanged
element.short: DataSetChanged - method to process a change in the data set attached to the navigator

element.name: TDBNavDataLink.ActiveChanged
element.short: ActiveChanged - method to process a change in the Active property of the navigator

element.name: TDBNavDataLink.Create
element.short: Create - constructor for TDBNavDataLink: calls inherited Create, attaches Navigator and sets VisualControl to True

element.name: TDBNavDataLink.Destroy
element.short: Destroy - destructor for TDBNavDataLink: frees Navigator and calls inherited Destroy

element.name: TDBNavigator
element.short: TDBNavigator - a data-aware Button-Bar to facilitate navigating between records of a dataset

descr.p: TDBNavigator is an advanced tool for navigating through datasets held locally in response to a query sent to the database.

It consists of a series of toolbuttons to move to the First, Prior, Next or Last record; to Insert or Delete a record; to Edit a record (enter Edit mode), to Post the changes. to Cancel the changes, and to Refresh the display from the database.
The programmer may determine, at design time, which buttons are to be displayed or suppressed by adjusting the VisibleButtons property in the Object Inspector.

If used in conjunction with a DataAware control such as TDBGrid or TDBMemo it controls which records are displayed , the position of the record selection cursor, and the initiation of changes to the dataset and ultimately the database.

Most of the functionality of the toolbar is already built-in to the control, but if the programmer needs to specify actions to be associated with individual buttons, there is a procedure TDBCustomNavigator.BtnClick to which an argument can be sent with the Index value of the button clicked, and the procedure chooses which action to call dependent on the button index.
The DataSource property must be set to link to the appropriate set of data.
HowToUseDataAwareControls - Hints for accessing databases. A set of Data-Aware components is provided, to make it easier to access information held in databases.

Before using Data-Aware components, it is necessary to make a connection with a database, and this should be done either using a TSQLConnection or a TDBf component, depending on the type of database that is being used. In any case, the components for connection with the database need to be found in $Lazdir/components/sqldb/, $Lazdir/components/tdbf/ or whatever other source is appropriate. They need to be added using the Components Menu Item of the IDE, and compiled ready for adding. The IDE needs to be re-built to include the new components.

To make the connection with the database: first place a DataBase Connection on the Form (invisible at run-time, so put it anywhere convenient); set its properties to connect the user (with name and password) to the appropriate server, database and table (the connection component should deal with all the user-authentication issues, opening and closing the database etc). Then put on a TDataSource from the Data Access tab of the Component Palette, and perhaps items such as TSQLTransaction and TSQLQuery, depending on the particular database you are using. The various database components need to be linked to each other, for example by setting the Transaction property of a database connector to the appropriate transaction component, and linking the DataBase property of the Transaction component back to the database connector; link the DataSource's DataSet property to the appropriate SQLQuery or other set of data, and its Transaction property to the transaction component

Each Data-Aware control (on the Data Controls tab of the Component Palette) has the usual set of properties to determine its shape and size, position, colour and font etc. But there are also special properties to define the data to be displayed or modified. These include the DataSource property which must be set to link to the defined set of data, and often a Field component to determine which of the columns in the database is to be displayed.

Most of the components operate on a single Row or record of the database, but the TDBGrid is capable of displaying and operating on multiple rows and columns, in a StringGrid format, allowing the user to get an overview of what is in the database. The DBGrid will display the contents of the DataSet even at design time, provided the various components are enabled or rendered active; this allows the designer to ensure that all the connections to the database have been correctly made.

The TDBNavigator component is used in conjunction with the Data-Aware components. It consists of a series of buttons to allow browsing through the DataSet, displaying the first, previous, next or last record (or Row), inserting or deleting records, committing the changes back to the database or refreshing the DataSet from the database.
The way database programming works is typically as follows:

ul.li: a database is opened for access by the user (Database Connection)
a command is issued (eg by TSQLQuery) to select or extract some or all of the records which are then stored locally in the DataSet

the contents of the DataSet are acted on by the Data-Aware components, displaying one Row or record at a time from selected Columns, or perhaps the whole DataSet in a DBGrid, editing records, inserting or deleting records, or using the data to perform statistical tests or calculations

at intervals usually prescribed by the user (sometimes after every change, sometimes after a whole series of changes), the contents of the local DataSet are sent back to the database, causing an update of the database's contents. This process is referred to as 'Commit' or 'Post' or sometimes as 'Update'

descr.p: The programmer can determine which events are associated with a Commit action by supplying suitable event handlers for OnClick, OnChange, OnFinishedEdit etc.
The following table shows the approximate correspondence between conventional and data-aware control classes

tr.td: Select a date from pop-up calendar
Check a box to show an option has been selected
Select an option from a list and return it (or some custom text) in the main edit box
A container for several related controls
A group of mutually exclusive Radio Buttons; only one at a time may be checked and selected. Note there is no data-aware equivalent of the isolated TRadioButton
A grid to display information in Rows and Columns

descr.p: Standard Controls can, of course, be used to display information from a database, but they lack the direct link with the DataSet and its Navigation aids, so the programmer must write explicit code to extract data from the DataSet and put it in the Standard Control
// standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants
Determines the border spacing for this control
Reads flag to find stored spacing values required for the border of the control, or writes the flag to set the spacing.
The properties are defined in the parent class TControlBorderSpacing
// standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants
Determines the border spacing for this control
Reads flag to find stored spacing values required for the border of the control, or writes the flag to set the spacing.
The properties are defined in the parent class TControlBorderSpacing

element.name: TDBListBox.OnDragOver
element.short: Event handler for the case when a control is dragged over another control

descr.p: // standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants

Reads flag to find stored spacing values required for the border of the control, or writes the flag to set the spacing.
The properties are defined in the parent class TControlBorderSpacing

element.name: TDBRadioGroup.OnStartDrag
element.short: Event handler for start of dragging process

descr.p: // standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants
Determines the border spacing for this control
Reads flag to find stored spacing values required for the border of the control, or writes the flag to set the spacing.
The properties are defined in the parent class TControlBorderSpacing
// standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants
Reads the value for colour, or stores the value, and sets a flag if the colour is stored.
The default colour is the same as the window in which the control is located.
// standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants
Determines the border spacing for this control
Reads flag to find stored spacing values required for the border of the control, or writes the flag to set the spacing.
The properties are defined in the parent class TControlBorderSpacing
// standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants
Reads the value for colour, or stores the value, and sets a flag if the colour is stored.
The default colour is the same as the window in which the control is located.
// standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants
Reads or Writes flag if bounds are changed

Double-clicking is much more common in a Windows environment than in Unix or Linux, where single-clicking is the default method for selecting an object. However, in all environments there could be valid use for a double-click, and a method should be supplied if appropriate.
// standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants
Determines the border spacing for this control
Reads flag to find stored spacing values required for the border of the control, or writes the flag to set the spacing.
The properties are defined in the parent class TControlBorderSpacing

element.name: TDBEdit.IsReadOnly
element.short: IsReadOnly - returns True if ReadOnly status is True

element.name: TDBEdit.CMGetDataLink
element.short: CMGetDataLink - LCL Message method for getting data link

element.name: TDBComboBox.ActiveChange
element.short: ActiveChange - if the datalink is active then send the changes, otherwise set the data to null

element.name: TDBComboBox.UpdateText
element.short: UpdateText - copy the new text via the datalink and calls inherited UpdateTExt

element.name: TDBMemo.ActiveChange
element.short: ActiveChange - if the data link is active, transmit the changed data to the sender

element.name: TDBImage.ActiveChange
element.short: ActiveChange - if datalink is active, send back new picture

element.name: TFieldDataLink.OnLayoutChange
element.short: OnLayoutChange - event handler for a change in the layout

element.name: TDBLookup
element.short: TDBLookup - used as source of data by TDBLookupListBox or TDBLookupComboBox, to find data from a lookup table

descr.p: TDBLookup component is typically owned by a Lookup control like TDBLookupListBox or TDBLookupComboBox.
The ListSource is the other dataset TDataSource from which to retrieve the lookup data
The KeyField is the lookup key in the ListSource which corresponds to the DataField value
The ListField is the name of the field in the ListSource to list into the Items property of the lookup control.

element.name: TDBLookup.Create
element.short: Create - constructor for TDBLookup: calls inherited Create, creates links with fields and data source, initialises ActiveChange and Editing properties

element.name: TDBLookup.Destroy
element.short: Destroy - destructor for TDBLookup: frees links and calls inherited Destroy

element.name: TDBLookup.Initialize
element.short: Initialize makes links between local Fields and the appropriate fields in the remote data source, then fetches the lookup data

element.name: TDBLookup.KeyFieldValueOf
element.short: KeyFieldValueOf - returns a key field value as a string from the given list field

element.name: TDBLookup.ListFieldValueOf
element.short: ListFieldValueOf - returns a listfield value as a string, given the key field value

element.name: TDBLookup.KeyField
element.short: The name of the KeyField used in the lookup search

element.name: TDBLookup.ListField
element.short: ListField - the name of the list field used in the lookup search

element.name: TDBLookup.ListFieldIndex
element.short: ListFieldIndex - the index value of the list field

element.name: TDBLookup.ListSource
element.short: ListSource - the data source that contains the lookup list

element.name: TCustomDBListBox
element.short: TCustomDBListBox - base class for TDBListBox, a data-aware listbox for presenting list information from a database

element.name: TCustomDBListBox.EditingChange
element.short: EditingChange - method for responding to a change in the Editing property

element.name: TCustomDBListBox.FocusRequest
element.short: FocusRequest - method for responding to a request to give this control focus

element.name: TCustomDBListBox.GetDataField
element.short: GetDataField - returns the name of the data field as a string

element.name: TCustomDBListBox.GetDataSource
element.short: GetDataSource - returns the identity of the data source

element.name: TCustomDBListBox.GetField
element.short: GetField - returns the identity of the field

element.name: TCustomDBListBox.SetItems
element.short: SetItems - copies the specified Values into the Items property

element.name: TCustomDBListBox.GetReadOnly
element.short: GetReadOnly - fetches the ReadOnly status from the field datalink rather than using the inherited ReadOnly status

element.name: TCustomDBListBox.SetReadOnly
element.short: SetReadOnly - changes the datalink ReadOnly property as well as the local property, to that specified by Value

element.name: TCustomDBListBox.SetDataField
element.short: SetDataField - links to the field in the datalink with the given name

element.name: TCustomDBListBox.SetDataSource
element.short: SetDataSource - changes the attached data source to the one specified by AValue

element.name: TCustomDBListBox.CMGetDataLink
element.short: CMGetDataLink - control message method for obtaining the data link

element.name: TCustomDBListBox.FDataLink
element.short: FDataLink - local variable holding the identity of the field data link

element.name: TCustomDBListBox.DataChange
element.short: DataChange - method for dealing with a change in the data

element.name: TCustomDBListBox.UpdateData
element.short: UpdateData - method for applying any pending changes to the data

element.name: TCustomDBListBox.Create
element.short: Create - constructor for TCustomDBListBox: calls inherited Create, makes links and sets up event handlers for data change, change in Editing status and updating data

element.name: TCustomDBListBox.Destroy
element.short: Destroy - destructor for TCustomEBListbox: frees data links then calls inherited Destroy

element.name: TCustomDBListBox.Field
element.short: The identity of the Field to which the listbox belongs

element.name: TCustomDBListBox.DataField
element.short: The name of the DataField to which the listbox belongs

element.name: TCustomDBListBox.DataSource
element.short: The identity of the DataSource from which the lookup data will be fetched

element.name: TCustomDBListBox.Items
element.short: Items - the data that form the list in the box

descr.p: Items - the data that form the list in the box
We need to overrride the write method for db aware.
The Read isn't an issue since the list will be updated on data change anyway

element.name: TCustomDBListBox.ReadOnly
element.short: ReadOnly - if True, the data can only be read but not written or edited

element.name: TDBLookupListBox
element.short: TDBLookupListBox, a data-aware listbox for presenting lookup list information from a database

element.name: TDBLookupListBox.DataChange
element.short: DataChange - triggered by a change in the data: finds the index of the field containing th changed value

element.name: TDBLookupListBox.Create
element.short: Create - constructor for TDBLookupListBox: calls inherited Create then creates lookup and forms linkd

element.name: TDBLookupListBox.KeyField
element.short: The KeyField holding the data

element.name: TDBLookupListBox.ListField
element.short: The ListField for the data

element.name: TDBLookupListBox.ListFieldIndex
element.short: ListFieldIndex - the index value for the listfield

element.name: TDBLookupListBox.ListSource
element.short: ListSource - the data source from which the list is obtained

element.name: TCustomDBComboBox
element.short: TCustomDBComboBox - a Data-aware Combo Box for displaying information from a Database

element.name: TCustomDBComboBox.DataChange
element.short: DataChange - updates any changes in text

element.name: TCustomDBComboBox.ActiveChange
element.short: ActiveChange - method to process a change in the Active state

element.name: TCustomDBComboBox.EditingChange
element.short: EditingChange - method to process a change in the Editing state

element.name: TCustomDBComboBox.Change
element.short: Change -if there has been a change to the data the link must be notified, then inherited Change is called

element.name: TCustomDBComboBox.UpdateData
element.short: UpdateData - implements any pending changes in the data

element.name: TCustomDBComboBox.FocusRequest
element.short: FocusRequest - sets focus in response to a request to do so

element.name: TCustomDBComboBox.EditingDone
element.short: EditingDone - updates data through the link, then calls inherited EditingDone

element.name: TCustomDBComboBox.Field
element.short: The Field to which this combobox is attached

element.name: TCustomDBComboBox.DataField
element.short: The name (as a string) of the Feild whose data are to be linked to the ComboBox

element.name: TCustomDBComboBox.DataSource
element.short: The identity of the DataSource to which the ComboBox is attached

element.name: TDBLookupComboBox
element.short: TDBLookupComboBox - a dataware ComboBox for examining a lookup table from a database

element.name: TDBLookupComboBox.UpdateData
element.short: UpdateData - copies the local data from the corresponding entry from the lookup field

element.name: TDBLookupComboBox.UpdateText
element.short: UpdateText - if the link is active, copies local text from the lookup table, otherwise calls inherited UpdateText

element.name: TDBLookupComboBox.Create
element.short: Create - constructor fro TDBLookupComboBox: calls inherited Create then makes lookup list, forms links

element.name: TDBLookupComboBox.KeyField
element.short: KeyField the name of the field containing the key data

element.name: TDBLookupComboBox.ListField
element.short: ListField - the name of the field containing the list data

element.name: TDBLookupComboBox.ListFieldIndex
element.short: ListFieldIndex - the index value of the field containing the list

element.name: TDBLookupComboBox.ListSource
element.short: ListSource the data source that contains the list

element.name: TDBGroupBox.CMGetDataLink
element.short: CMGetDataLink - control message for finding the data link

element.name: TDBImage.Change
element.short: Change - if picture is changes, datalink needs to be informed

element.name: TDBCalendar.UpdateDate
element.short: UpdateDate - implements any pending changes in the date selected

element.name: TDBCalendar.CMGetDataLink
element.short: CMGetDataLink - control message method for getting the data link
